Prior experience/background in credit risk preferred.Formal credit training preferred.Experience with borrower rating systems and tracking methodologies, and basic knowledge of fiscal and financial condition indicators preferred. Experience as an underwriter and familiarity with credit administration systems typically used by financial institutions preferred.

title: Entry Level Field Vibration Analyst
company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
job_description: Job DescriptionWood's Consulting business is currently seeking an Entry Level Field Vibration Analyst/Engineer to join our Field Engineering & Troubleshooting team in Pittsburgh, PA. This is field-based position requiring traveling 50% of time to customer facilities. The Entry Level Field Vibration Analyst/Engineer will perform a variety of data collection, troubleshooting and problem-solving activities for machinery, piping and structural systems (across all industries). This role provides excellent learning opportunities to grow in the machinery diagnostics and reliability world, and is an opportunity to work with industry-leading machinery and vibration experts. Suitable for a dynamic individual, who is entrepreneurial and interested in consultative work.This is an opportunity to work in a global organization with an industry-leading position based on its niche range of services, and to be involved in projects both locally, and around the world. Currently, Wood offers several services within the vibration, dynamics and noise team, and there will be advancement opportunities as the business grows.ResponsibilitiesPerform vibration analysis by acquiring vibration data using different data acquisition hardware and their software applicationsEvaluate operational issues by evaluating vibration data, process conditions, machine performance, maintenance data and customer communicationTroubleshoot on piping systems, structures, reciprocating and centrifugal compressors, reciprocating and centrifugal pumps, gas and steam turbines, gearboxes, motors, engines and other equipment for land based and offshore facilitiesBalancing of rotating equipmentInteract with operations, maintenance, and inspection personnelPerform equipment vibration and performance assessments for rotating equipment packagesPrepare timely and accurate technical reports to professional standardsImplement and adhere to Wood - Vibration, Dynamics & Noise (VDN) HSSE policies and best practices at all work sitesStrong verbal communication skills, with the ability to speak directly to the issue and to adapt to work environment and customers' communication styleAbility to establish strong working relationships with customers. Strong customer focus and the desire to go the extra mileQUALIFICATIONSMechanical Engineer or Technologist (BSME or BSMET)New graduate or with 0-5 years of job-related experienceGood knowledge of vibration fundamentals and interest in investigating and troubleshooting vibration problems, with basic understanding of performance, reliability, and maintenance issuesIdeally have some exposure to vibration data acquisition systems and their software, in the industry or in university vibration laboratoryExcellent communication and analytical skills; working knowledge of computer systems and integrated software application programsPosition requires up to 50% travel. Travel is mainly continental United States with some international travel. Work also includes offshore facilitiesIdeally understand rotating machinery including reciprocating and centrifugal compressors, reciprocating and centrifugal pumps, gas and steam turbines, gearboxes, motors, engines and other equipmentHave an interest in acoustic theory, multiphase flow, and transients. Proficient in standard windows software and ideally have some understanding of software related to vibration data acquisition systemsValid driver's license with good driving historyCurrent passport with eligibility to travel Must be a US citizen or authorized to work lawfully in the US, without sponsorship from Wood.ABOUT USWood is a global leader in consulting and engineering, helping to unlock solutions to critical challenges in energy and materials markets. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in 60 countries, employing around 35,000 people. www.woodplc.comDiversity Statement We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Medical Lab Quality Control Analyst (HYBRID)
job_description: Please note that this is a 1 year contract position. Position is Hybrid (onsite 3-4 days), Day Shift (normal work hours) This role is split between 2 functions: Lab Support/Managing Systems, and Biovia Med Tasks (metrology) Providing support for the equipment Schedule to have activities done on the equipment Open and Close work orders about tasks on equipment Experience with Biovia or LMS is highly preferred Manage alarms or alerts on equipment Must have at least 2 years of experience This environment will be highly automated Role falls under "System Specialist" kind of roleThis is a 50/50 split role between two groups but within the same function. Below are details for each role:General Requirements For The RoleExcellent communications skills requiredExcellent Time Management And Organizational Skills RequiredTrack record of being able to multi-taskPrevious GxP Experience PreferredPrevious inventory management experience preferred (Maximo would be an example)Familiarity with Biovia or LIMs software preferredBiovia Equipment Tasks (50%)Metrology event alignment between groups.I get an error list daily with the events that won t update to OneLab because of a mismatch among the instruments in the type. This most often occurs because one or more instruments have a different interval.There is a list for event addition and event synchronization.New equipment addition.A daily readout of Maximo provides a list of equipment missing from OneLab.The list needs to be cleaned before any instruments can be imported to OneLab.Curation of EquipmentDecommissioned instruments need to be inactivated in OneLab.Most importantly is decommissioned child equipment.Metrology correctionsWhen a new event is created in Maximo with a different description or different event type, that becomes a new event in OneLab. The old event will not update and can t be removed. The old event now will need to be manually updated forever to not interfere with the current events.PAS CAL Support (50%)Manage analytical equipment related to Cal Lab in M11Schedule and host vendor visits for repairs and calibration activityCommunicate with PAS Team on instrument related itemsObtain quotes and purchase vendor contracts on equipmentWork within Maximo system for scheduling and work order activitiesAssist with onboarding of new assets and decommissioning of retired systemsManage pipets within the laboratoryApplicants must provide their phone number. Reference job number A4005.

title: Sr. Financial Analyst
job_description: Are you ready to unlock your true potential? Join a growing and global company where you can be part of a team that fuels supply chain solutions. Discover how you can make a big impact.We are looking for a highly motivated, energetic, and experienced Sr. Financial Analyst to support our FP&A team. The role is an excellent opportunity to support the Finance organization at an exciting time in the company’s trajectory. As a key interface between Finance and executive management, you will be part of the financial planning and analysis function that has a comprehensive understanding of all key business drivers. The Sr. Financial Analyst will partner across functional lines and work with the corporate finance team to drive financial and management reporting. You will report to the Vice President of Finance, Planning & Analysis and support key leadership across all functional areas.This is a REMOTE OPPORTUNITYA Sr. Financial Analyst Will Be Responsible ForAutomating and continuously improving our monthly reporting and forecasting process, which includes financial statement analysis, KPI reporting, and actual versus budget/forecast/prior year variances.Conducting variance analyses to effectively communicate business results, trends, risks and opportunities to Management.Assisting in consolidation of company annual plan and monthly forecasts, analyzing key performance trends in revenue, cost of goods sold, and expenses.Working cross functionally to ensure accurate reporting on all financial metrics, forecasts, and key performance indicators.Managing multiple data sources to ensure integrity, consistency, and quality of data.Assisting in the preparation of Management, Executive Team, and Board of Directors reports/presentations.Supporting ad-hoc financial modeling, analysis, and building presentations to support business needs and facilitate the decision-making process, as needed by the office of the CFO and organization.Requirements For SuccessBachelor’s degree in Accounting or FinanceMinimum of 2+ years of experience in financial planning and analysisExperience reporting & forecasting financial statementsExcellent working knowledge of Excel, Powerpoint, ThinkCell, PowerBI, NetSuite or the equivalentExcellent interpersonal and organization skills with an ability to handle multiple activities, prioritize and manage workload, and perform multiple tasks simultaneouslyExceptional verbal and written communicationsStrong analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skillsCuriosity, resourcefulness, flexibility and a collaborative approach Self-starter and action-oriented; confident under pressure and able to consistently meet deadlinesDemonstrated experience providing ideas and solutions to further business understandingWho is TrueCommerce?TrueCommerce is a high-performing global supply chain network that provides fully integrated, end-to-end supply chain visibility and management. We’ve empowered some of the biggest brands in the world to improve their supply chain performance: Schneider Electric, DanoneWave, Siemen’s, Ocean Spray, and many more.For additional information, visit our website.

title: Oracle Fusion/ERP Testing/Automation lead
job_description: Job Title: Oracle Fusion/ERP Testing/Automation leadTechnical/Functional Skills -MUST HAVE SKILLSFusion Application Configuration experience including workflow(s) , FBDI's ,Rest APIs, Fusion Data model ,OTBI reports and dashboardRoles & ResponsibilitiesEstimate, Commit and Deliver with support of Offshore teamTrack and Report on Delivery work through JiraHelp with hands on resolution of P1 production issuesImplement and follow the Sun model i.e. coordinate and hand off and take over from OffshoreDevelops, implements, and manages processes to ensure that products meet required specifications for quality, function, and reliability prior to delivery.Identifies and sets appropriate quality standards and parameters for products.Communicates quality standards and parameters to QA team, product development team, and other appropriate staff.Coordinates product testing processes.Participate in Technical Grooming and Work with Solution Designer, Business Analyst & Dev Manager to understand the API requirements of Epics & User Stories.Participates in product testing.Identifies and analyzes issues, bugs, defects, and other problems, particularly when problems recur in multiple products; recommends and facilitates solutions to these issues.Reviews client, customer, and user feedback.Maintains compliance with federal, state, local, and organizational laws, regulations, guidelines, and policies.Performs other duties as assignedCreate a BDD test features & scenarios using Behave BDD framework to validate the Business flow and API responses for the assigned User stories each sprint.Implement Step Definitions in Python for each test steps defined in the BDD feature.Work with TDM team to get required test data for Automation execution.Work with Developers to triage & track the bugs created till closure.Enhance the Python Test Automation framework for reusability & easy maintenance.Co-ordinate with Front End & User Acceptance Test teams to elaborate the new features and help them to triage issues.Identify and implement process improvement opportunities to create efficiency or improve test coverage.

title: Custom Drug Product Sales Sr. Manager-North America
job_description: Role SummaryPfizer CentreOne is a global contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) embedded within Pfizer, delivering over $1B+ in revenue in 2021. Pfizer CentreOne reports into the Chief Business & Innovation Office (CBIO).Pfizer CentreOne leverages Pfizer manufacturing plants as well as science and technology resources to manufacture medicine for biopharmaceutical companies. Pfizer CentreOne focusses on active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) synthesis, drug products (sterile injectable fill-finish and oral solids) and is a lead supplier of steroid and hormone APIs and intermediates. For almost 50 years, Pfizer CentreOnes’ dedicated team of contract manufacturing experts has been guiding our partners’ drugs safely from development to commercial manufacture.Role ResponsibilitiesAs Senior Sales Manager you will:Identify and pursue new leads and business opportunities, while also ensuring communication to both internal and external stakeholders. Responsible for initiating new business relationships and selling in North America. Liaise with PGS (Pfizer Global Supply) and other internal resources to obtain information necessary to develop and issue proposals to potential clients, facilitate due diligence plant visits and meetings, and to formulate and negotiate complex development and supply contracts. Have a deep understanding of the Pfizer CentreOne / PGS governance process that defines selling capacities and capabilities of individual sites. Develop a working relationship with respective stakeholders. Drive growth:Be accountable for achieving Pfizer CentreOne sales targets and driving growth in North America. Responsible for finding and developing new product and service opportunities, utilizing cold calls, lead follow-up and other personal and network driven chances. Develop and defend business rationale and case for new opportunities. Collaborate with Pfizer CentreOne commercial and PGS manufacturing teams to create and issue proposals, facilitate prospect site visits, and perform company / product due diligence. In collaboration with internal stakeholders such as legal, negotiate and formulate contracts for all new deals. For operationalizing new deals, ensure a smooth transition to respective team after a contract is signed. Lead customer relationships:Be the expert and primary contact for and on the target companies by initiating and maintaining relationships for all targeted products. Actively manage client relationship to help resolve issues, conduct business reviews as required, provide contract assistance, and other necessary duties to maintain client satisfaction and achieve corporate business objectives. Gain customer and market insights:Utilize external market intelligence sources, work with the Business Analyst and the Pipeline Development & Innovation Team to identify new leads and business opportunities. Utilize and contribute to Pfizer CentreOne marketing campaigns, sponsored conferences, and local networking events to expand market knowledge, competitive intelligence, and contacts. Drive collaboration for business planning:Maintain sales forecast and assist in development of long-term sales plan(s), along with updates to management on sales and earnings progress versus long-term plan(s). Understand customers’ pipeline, strategic outsourcing decisions, potential consolidation, or divestiture plans and other areas that could provide potential future opportunities and partnerships. Develop, maintain, and execute strategic customer business plan and client relations. Discuss and align account performance and strategy with internal stakeholders (such as PGS, development services, commercial). Basic Qualifications BA/BS in Sciences, Engineering or Business required; Master's Degree or Ph.D. is preferred. Strong business acumen: Significant (>5 years) pharmaceutical industry experience, in commercial / selling. Outstanding communication, presentation, and interpersonal skillsNegotiation experience including pricing, contracts, and other business-related activities. Project management skills: Proven, mature client handling, issue resolution and expectation management skills, demonstrated result-orientation, tenacity, and follow-through. Strong networking skills: Must have prior experience interacting in a global environment with cross-functional disciplines in a highly matrixed environment (e.g., Manufacturing, Research & Development, Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs functions). Knowledge of OSD and SI drug product technologies, API& Biological drug substance technologies as well as of local markets, cultural differences, customer requirements, local trade and credit practices, government requirements, credit terms, shipping practices, sales service requirements, and all major competitive factors. Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact. Preferred QualificationsExperience in oral solid dose or drug substance manufacturing and/or work experience with small biopharmaceutical companies. Proficiency in Pfizer tools and processes, such as Microsoft Office, SAP, Salesforce.com, Concur and others as they arise. Non-standard Work Schedule, Travel Or Environment RequirementsMinimum of 25% travel required; travel is dependent on meeting growth/revenue targets. Domestic and international travel to visit with PGS sites, technology partners and potential customers. Work Location Assignment: Pfizer Site 2.5 times/week. Other InformationLast date to apply: April 28, 2024Work Location Assignment: FlexibleThe annual base salary for this position ranges from $117,300.00 to $195,500.00.* In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 17.5% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided does not apply to Tampa, FL or any location outside of the United States. The annual base salary for this position in Tampa, FL ranges from $105,500.00 to $175,900.00. Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.Sunshine ActPfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.EEO & Employment EligibilityPfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. This position requires permanent work authorization in the United States.Sales

title: Java Developer
job_description: Employment Type: Full-TimeDepartment: Information TechnologyCGS is seeking a Java developer/programmer to join a team working on the enhancement of data utilization for a large, state-run project. title: Entry Level Field Vibration Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionWood’s Consulting business is currently seeking an Entry Level Field Vibration Analyst/Engineer to join our Field Engineering & Troubleshooting team in Pittsburgh, PA. This is field-based position requiring traveling 50% of time to customer facilities. The Entry Level Field Vibration Analyst/Engineer will perform a variety of data collection, troubleshooting and problem-solving activities for machinery, piping and structural systems (across all industries). This role provides excellent learning opportunities to grow in the machinery diagnostics and reliability world, and is an opportunity to work with industry-leading machinery and vibration experts. Suitable for a dynamic individual, who is entrepreneurial and interested in consultative work.This is an opportunity to work in a global organization with an industry-leading position based on its niche range of services, and to be involved in projects both locally, and around the world. Currently, Wood offers several services within the vibration, dynamics and noise team, and there will be advancement opportunities as the business grows.ResponsibilitiesPerform vibration analysis by acquiring vibration data using different data acquisition hardware and their software applicationsEvaluate operational issues by evaluating vibration data, process conditions, machine performance, maintenance data and customer communicationTroubleshoot on piping systems, structures, reciprocating and centrifugal compressors, reciprocating and centrifugal pumps, gas and steam turbines, gearboxes, motors, engines and other equipment for land based and offshore facilitiesBalancing of rotating equipmentInteract with operations, maintenance, and inspection personnelPerform equipment vibration and performance assessments for rotating equipment packagesPrepare timely and accurate technical reports to professional standardsImplement and adhere to Wood – Vibration, Dynamics & Noise (VDN) HSSE policies and best practices at all work sitesStrong verbal communication skills, with the ability to speak directly to the issue and to adapt to work environment and customers’ communication styleAbility to establish strong working relationships with customers. Strong customer focus and the desire to go the extra mileQualificationsMechanical Engineer or Technologist (BSME or BSMET)New graduate or with 0-5 years of job-related experienceGood knowledge of vibration fundamentals and interest in investigating and troubleshooting vibration problems, with basic understanding of performance, reliability, and maintenance issuesIdeally have some exposure to vibration data acquisition systems and their software, in the industry or in university vibration laboratoryExcellent communication and analytical skills; working knowledge of computer systems and integrated software application programsPosition requires up to 50% travel. Travel is mainly continental United States with some international travel. Work also includes offshore facilitiesIdeally understand rotating machinery including reciprocating and centrifugal compressors, reciprocating and centrifugal pumps, gas and steam turbines, gearboxes, motors, engines and other equipmentHave an interest in acoustic theory, multiphase flow, and transients. Proficient in standard windows software and ideally have some understanding of software related to vibration data acquisition systemsValid driver’s license with good driving historyCurrent passport with eligibility to travel Must be a US citizen or authorized to work lawfully in the US, without sponsorship from Wood.About UsWood is a global leader in consulting and engineering, helping to unlock solutions to critical challenges in energy and materials markets. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in 60 countries, employing around 35,000 people. www.woodplc.comDiversity Statement We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Senior PHP Developer
job_description: firstPRO is hiring a talented Senior PHP Developer with a minimum of 5 years of experience to join our client located in Philadelphia, PA. A successful candidate will have experience with Enterprise Architecture Development, REST Microservices, Linux, OOP principles/class design experience. This role is a contract to hire opportunity and has a hybrid work model which requires 2 days onsite.ResponsibilitiesDevelop PHP web applications using frameworks like CodeIgniter, following industry best practices.Understand and implement fully synchronous behavior in PHP.Support front-end development using JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3.Write quality back-end code and build efficient PHP modules using object-oriented programming.Work with SQL/NoSQL databases and their query languages.Familiarity with Linux OS, virtual machines, and REST APIs.Create technical/design documents as needed.Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges.Ensure accessibility and security compliance.Implement design principles for scalable applications.Integrate multiple data sources and databases.Use code versioning tools such as Git.Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle and deliver quality code after thorough unit testing.Handle multiple priorities and provide support to resolve production issues.RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field preferred.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Experience interacting directly with all levels of business stakeholders.Strong experience in software development, particularly in enterprise architecture.Business analyst-like mentality with the ability to understand and translate business requirements.Proficiency in designing and developing REST Microservice systems.Experience working with Linux-based systems.Familiarity with Azure services is a plus.Solid understanding of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles and class design..Net development experience strongly preferred.

title: Senior Security Technology Analyst
job_description: At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!What You Can Expect At BBHIf you join BBH you will find a collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can. You will have direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world. BBH will provide you with opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm. We encourage a culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective. We provide a high-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind. Ultimately we want you to have rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage. Our BBH Cares program offers volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others.Senior Security Technology Analyst The Security Technology Analyst, Senior assists in the management and development of security technology for data, systems, networks and applications. This position is responsible for evaluating and implementing products and procedures to enhance security productivity and effectiveness. The Senior Security Technology Analyst provides direct support to the business and IT staff on security related issues.Responsibilities IncludeInformation SecurityAssist in the development and implementation of security systems and its associated software.Review requests for new systems or changes to existing systems and evaluate the impact to security.Monitor daily reports to ensure the effectiveness of new and existing security technology. Partner with system owners to ensure the integrity, availability and confidentiality of information residing in corporate databases, workstations, servers or being transmitted over the network. Assist in the design and implementation of disaster recovery plans.Security ProductEvaluate and implement products and/or procedures to enhance security. Provide post implementation support for new security technology. Research emerging security products, services, protocols and standards, in support of security enhancement and development efforts. Recommend, deploy and monitor additional security products and tools or enhancements to existing tools.Security SupportProvide direct support to the business on security related issues. Educate the business about security policies and provide consultation on security issues. Assist in representing the security needs of the organization by providing security expertise and assistance on all IT projects. Assist with the development and enforcement of IT security policies, guidelines, standards and procedures.EducationBachelor’s degree in systems or specialized training required. 5 or more years of relevant work experience. Experience in the financial services industry.Knowledge and skillsExperience with the BBH business and its practices. Knowledge of industry information security standards and practices, including applicable laws related to data privacy and protection. Knowledge of network and security components, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, anti virus software and data encryption. Strong knowledge of IP, TCP/IP and other network administration protocols, including their vulnerabilities and solutions required.Knowledge of operating platforms, database and sub-system platforms and products. Technical proficiency with Checkpoint Firewall I preferred. Ability to handle multiple priorities, while meeting deadlines. Strong problem solving, organizational and project management skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills.Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), a plus Security certifications, a plusWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.
Industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Management

of a good communication strategy within the project to ensure that all stakeholders are regularly briefed.Taking ownership of project tasks and deliverables.Build close partnerships and liaise with title: INFORMATION SECURITY ANALYST II (Hybrid)
job_description: At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world. Job OverviewTE Connectivity’s Information Security and Compliance Teams execute security controls to prevent hackers from infiltrating company information or jeopardizing e-commerce programs. The research attempted to compromise security protocols, maintain security systems for routers and switches, administer security policies to control system access, maintain the company’s firewall, and use applicable encryption methods. TE’s Security and Compliance Teams also provide management with information regarding the negative impact on the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration, or denial of access to information.The Cyber Defense Analyst manages and monitors the security controls that protect the company's assets. This includes, but is not limited to, identifying security threats and vulnerabilities, implementing protective measures, and responding to any information security incidents.The Cyber Defense Analyst will be exposed to a range of aspects of security (Operations, Investigations, Network, Server, Identity and Access, Endpoint, Application, Incident Response, Authentication/Authorization, Vulnerability Management, Penetration Testing, Automation/Orchestration, analytics, training and awareness, threat modeling, etc.) and will ultimately focus on the areas in which their skills and interests overlap with the needs of the company and team.Responsibilities & QualificationsResponsibilities will vary based on the candidate’s experience and skills, which are aligned with the needs of the Cyber Defense Team. The following are some examples of potential responsibilities: Handling access requests, Working with ticketing systems, Security Event Monitoring and Investigation, Incident Response, Security Data Analytics, Security Control Management (Firewall, Intrusion Detection, Endpoint detection and Response, Vulnerability Management, etc.) Security Training and Awareness Experience: At least three years of IT experience. Active Directory Experience with account management Experience with email analysis Must have technology passion and stay current with emerging security trends. The motivation to learn by investigating, learning from others, and sharing their knowledge. Excellent verbal & written communication and presentation skills. Must be able to communicate effectively to executive and developer levels. Experience with new technology evaluations, software package selection, and buy vs. build analysis—the ability to influence others outside their direct control area and be seen as a team player.Primary Responsibilities Cyber Alert Monitoring / Cyber Threat Hunting - Identifying and reacting to threats throughout the organization utilizing a variety of security tools Incident Response - Responsible for incident investigation, including host, network, and log forensics Security Automation and Orchestration (SAO) - Responsible for managing and developing the SAO platform Security Controls Management - Manage the entire suite of Enterprise Security Controls, including (but not limited to) EDR, UEBA, SIEM, Intrusion Detection/Prevention, 2-factor solutions, vulnerability scanning, sandboxes, encryption technologies, authentication/authorization solutions, Data Loss Prevention, flow monitoring, etc. Red/Blue Fusion Team - Participate in regular penetration tests of our environment from both internal and external locationsRequiredWhat your background should look like: Experience implementing and managing security solutions Demonstrated experience in understanding networking technologies and protocols Systems administration experience with Windows or UNIX-based operating systems Demonstrated experience with at least one programming/scripting language Capable of consulting with technical and business teams to understand their security issues and communicate on a tactical and strategic level. Must have a passion for technology and stay current with emerging security trends. Excellent verbal & written communication and presentation skills. Must be able to communicate effectively to executive and developer levels.Preferred Experience with some security tools and technologies, including but not limited to: EDR UEBA SIEM Intrusion Detection/Prevention Penetration Testing Malware Analysis/Reverse Engineering Vulnerability scanning Encryption technologies Etc. Experience working in a global organization. Experience with threat intelligence and risk evaluation Experience with performing security auditsThe qualified candidate must have a passion for security and strong technical knowledge across a broad technology spectrum. Must understand security technology trends, standards, marketplace offerings, best practices, and how to apply them. You must also be able to lead others through collaboration, teamwork, and thought leadership.Educational Required/DesiredUndergraduate degree in an Information Technology/Systems discipline OR other equivalent work experience/certifications.CompetenciesValues: Integrity, Accountability, Inclusion, Innovation, TeamworkCompensation Competitive base salary commensurate with experience: $78,400 - $117,600 (subject to change dependent on physical location) Posted salary ranges are made in good faith. TE Connectivity reserves the right to adjust ranges depending on the experience/qualification of the selected candidate as well as internal and external equity. Total Compensation = Base Salary + Incentive(s) + BenefitsBenefits A comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, 401(k), disability, life insurance, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and voluntary benefits.EOE, Including Disability/Vets

title: End User Computing Engineer
job_description: HTC is seeking an End-User Computing Engineer to join our practice on site in Sayre, Penn - partially remote. We offer great salaries, full benefits and tons of other HTC perks.JOB DESCRIPTIONMain FunctionThe End-User Computing Engineer is a senior role entrusted to lead the selection and efficient and effective management of the company’s global end user computing platforms. This includes developing and maintaining a single consistent OS image globally and troubleshooting and resolving any issues on any deployed end-user computing platforms. Much like a business analyst, this role has responsibility for working with business clients to elicit and document requirements used to select new and modify/improve existing end-user computing platforms to include both hardware and software. This role also has responsibility for quantifying and selecting a standard set of end-user computing devices including workstations, monitors, input devices, printers, tablets, and any other types of end-user computing connected devices.Education/ExperienceA Baccalaureate Degree or degree from an accredited college or university; ORAn Associate’s Degree from an accredited college or university and a minimum of one year work experience; ORA satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.Essential DutiesSupport and maintain the global end-user computing platforms and related standard peripherals insuring high performance and reliability.Assist End-User Computing Technicians with the fulfillment of service requests and with the resolution of incidents where lack of knowledge may present a barrier to such.Perform in-depth root cause analysis of recurring end-user computing problems and define actions for timely resolution. Work with key vendors as necessary to assist with root cause analysis and problem resolution.Plan, architect, design, document and implement end-user computing platform, operating system, enterprise software, and peripheral upgrades to improve services provided to all business clients.Design routine monitoring to be used by After-Hours Support Technicians, and continually tune alerts to assure consistent, reliable operation of the global end-user computing systems.Perform complex end-user computing administration tasks, as necessary, to assure the reliable operation of global end-user computing platforms, including systemwide software updates and patches.Work closely with a Information Services peers and management emphasizing collaboration and joint effort to ensure that the needs and expectations of our business partners are met and/or exceeded.Transfer knowledge via documentation and training to End-User Computing Technicians and the Help Desk.ExperienceExperience specifying, troubleshooting, and maintaining Microsoft compatible end-user computing platforms and peripherals running Microsoft Windows Operation Systems including Windows 10 and Windows 7.Experience creating, troubleshooting, and maintaining a single global Microsoft operating system end-user computing Gold Image, including all necessary device drivers and enterprise software.Experience troubleshooting software related issues on the Microsoft PC operating systems including Windows 10 and Windows 7.Experience using Microsoft tools to troubleshoot, isolate and resolve issues on end-user computing devices, including identifying and eliminating malware.Experience deploying and maintaining hardware, software, software updates and operating system images in a global environment using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM), Manage Engine, or other deployment tool.Windows scripting knowledge and experience using recent versions of Microsoft PowerShell and/or VisualStudio.Experience with various Intel based computing systems including desktop, laptop, and tablet hardware.Basic understanding multiple processor server systems, RAID hardware, SCSI attached, and large storage solutions.Basic understanding of LAN/WAN network infrastructure technologies .Basic understanding of security technologies including firewalls, antivirus, spyware, SPAM management, and VPN.A+ certification a plus.ITIL Certification is a plus .ProficienciesTeam Player with proven leadership, communication, organizational, and strong interpersonal skills. The role requires significant interaction with many different teams across healthcare system.Self-motivated, with keen attention to detail and excellent judgment skills.Ability to establish new standards for quality, performance or productivity.Must have excellent writing and communication skills, strong communicator with ability to maintain open communication with internal employees, contractors, managers, vendors, and customers as needed.Able to integrate and apply feedback in a professional manner.Able to prioritize and drive quality.Benefits: At HTC Global Services our associates have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes Health, Dental, Vision, Paid-Time-Off, Paid Holidays, 401K matching, Life and Accidental Death Insurance, Short- & Long-Term Disability Insurance, and a variety of other offerings. Diversity & Inclusion: Our success as a company is built on practicing inclusion and embracing diversity. HTC Global Services is committed to providing a work environment free from discrimination and harassment, where all employees are treated with respect and dignity. Together we work to create and maintain an environment where everyone feels valued, included, and respected. At HTC Global Services, our differences are embraced and celebrated. HTC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce. HTC is proud to be recognized as a National Minority Supplier.

title: Data Analyst Intern
job_description: PSECU, a high-tech progressive financial institution with more than $8 billion in assets, is seeking a Data Analyst Intern will report directly to the Business Intelligence Manager and is responsible for creating standard or ad hoc queries or reports to extract data from disparate databases or data sources. Additionally, this role may support advanced analytics initiatives including data mining, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling efforts.Employee Type: Part-Time, Non-exemptSchedule: Monday-Friday - 8:00am-4:00pm during the summer, flexible schedule during school year, 20% onsite at our office located in Harrisburg, PA.Training: Will be a mix of in office/at home, approximately 15-30 hoursSalary: Up to $20.00/hr. Reports will be designed, coded, tested, debugged, documented and maintained using business intelligence standards.Under general supervision, review the integrity, accuracy, and security of the Business Intelligence reports and data.Participate with other specialists to convert legacy reports to the Credit Unions BI solution.Familiar with modern business intelligence tools like Power BI, Tableau, LookerProvide support to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards for Credit Union users.Provide training and assistance to users for generation of ad-hoc reports.Works with technical staff to understand problems with BI reports and resolves them.Ability to analyze BI reports and respond with suggestions for improvements and enhancements.Minimum ExperienceMINIMUM / PREFERRED EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION: Upcoming Junior or Senior studying Data Analytics/Science, Applied Mathematics, Finance, Information Systems, or related field.Or any equivalent combination of experience and education.Preferred ExperienceExperience performing statistical analysis and/or creating predictive models.Experience using R or Python
